channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Olive Garden owner’s CEO says fast food is so expensive you might as well have a sit-down meal
item.description: McDonald’s and Wendy’s have vexed budget-conscious consumers, and chains like Chili’s and Olive Garden are ready to take advantage.

item.title: OpenAI acquires database analytics firm Rockset
item.description: Rockset said it will power the retrieval infrastructure of the ChatGPT maker, likely improving the speed and accuracy of responses from AI models.

item.title: What to expect from gold, oil and other commodities in the second half of 2024
Say goodbye to the 20% down payment. Zillow says you’ll need to put down roughly 35%, or almost $128,000, to afford a typical home
item.description: In Los Angeles, a median-income household would need to put roughly 80% down to afford a typical home and its monthly payments in the city, according to Zillow.

item.title: More single-family built-for-rent homes are under construction in the U.S.
item.description: More single-family built-for-rent homes are under construction. Here's what to consider if you need more space but can't afford to buy.

item.title: Why the Supreme Court just made taxes an even bigger election issue
Supreme Court upholds ‘common sense’ law banning domestic abusers from gun possession in 8-1 decision
item.description: A week after overturning a ban on bump stocks, the court allowed a law than bans guns for people under restraining orders.

item.title: Nearly $109 million in fintech Yotta's customer deposits vanished in Synapse collapse, bank says
item.description: Despite mounting pressure to unfreeze all locked bank accounts in the Synapse collapse, messy records have created uncertainty over when that will happen.

item.title: Why Miller High Life is now on the menu at some of the fanciest restaurants
Incoming Washington Post editor won’t take the job after newsroom revolt: ‘The body is rejecting the transfusion’
item.description: Post staff had revolted at the leadership change. “The body is rejecting the transfusion,” one said.

item.title: Surging government red ink spurs economists' worries over a prolonged recession and market trouble
item.description: Burgeoning debt and deficits are threatening to make the next recession deeper while tying the hands of policymakers.

item.title: Home prices hit an all-time high, despite sluggish spring home-buying season
90% of C-suite executives believe their company promotes worker well-being. Why do only 60% of workers agree?
item.description: The third annual Workplace Well-being report from Deloitte indicates a major gulf in understanding between executives and employees.

item.title: Trump Media free fall continues, as DJT stock slides 6%
item.description: Trump Media, which trades as DJT, has lost more than half its value since a New York jury convicted Trump on 34 felony counts of falsifying business records.

item.title: U.S. economy flexes muscles in June, S&P finds, as businesses are optimistic
